TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in Nideggen in GPE .
In DATE police officers searched the applicant ’s premises in order to seize evidence relating to an offence of unlawful assumption of authority allegedly committed by the applicant in DATE .
In DATE ORG preferred an indictment against the applicant with ORG ( Amtsgericht ) .

In DATE police officers once again searched the applicant ’s premises in order to seize evidence relating to CARDINAL counts of falsification of documents allegedly committed by the applicant in DATE , DATE and DATE .
In DATE ORG preferred an indictment against the applicant with ORG .

On DATE the GPE ORG , having joined to the proceedings CARDINAL further indictments relating to criminal offences allegedly committed by the applicant in DATE , DATE and DATE , DATE and DATE , held a hearing during which the applicant was represented by the court - appointed counsel P.

Following the hearing , the GPE ORG convicted the applicant of CARDINAL counts of falsification of documents , CARDINAL count of unlawful assumption of authority in conjunction with attempted coercion , falsification of documents , bodily injury and falsely casting suspicion on an innocent person and CARDINAL counts of insult and sentenced him to DATE and CARDINAL months’ imprisonment , suspended on probation . ORG considered as mitigating factors that the applicant had made a confession and that some of the offences had been committed DATE .
Parallel to these proceedings , public prosecution instituted separate proceedings against the applicant before ORG for falsification of documents allegedly committed by the applicant in DATE .

On DATE ORG appointed the lawyer PERSON to represent the applicant during the proceedings before that court . As PERSON was unable to attend the hearing scheduled for DATE , ORG , on that same date , absolved her from her duties .
On DATE ORG convicted the applicant , who was not represented by counsel , of falsification of documents and sentenced him to a fine of MONEY .

On DATE the Aachen ORG ( Landgericht ) , in joint proceedings , rejected the applicant ’s appeal against the judgments of CARDINAL and DATE as inadmissible on the ground that the applicant had failed to attend the court hearing held on CARDINAL DATE .

On DATE the applicant applied for the reinstatement of the proceedings . He alleged that he had been unable to attend the court hearing as he had been admitted to intensive care from DATE due to an emergency . In support of his allegations , he named his brother as a witness .

On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s request . It noted that the applicant had failed to submit sufficient information as to the nature of his illness , the name of the treating practitioner or the hospital he had been admitted to , nor had he submitted sufficient evidence supporting his allegations .

On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal . In support of his allegations , he submitted a letter by the ORG hospital dated CARDINAL DATE . According to the content of that letter , the applicant had been admitted to intensive surveillance after having complained about having suffered an electric shock while blow - drying his hair . The medical examination did not disclose any abnormalities .

On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s appeal . That court considered that the applicant had failed to establish that he had been hindered to attend the court hearing through no fault of his own . ORG considered that the hospital letter submitted by the applicant was exclusively based on the applicant ’s own statement on the alleged electric shock incident and that the medical examination had not disclosed any abnormalities .
On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal on points of law against ORG judgment of CARDINAL DATE .

On DATE ORG ( Oberlandesgericht ) rejected the applicant ’s appeal as inadmissible on the ground that the applicant had failed to submit the grounds for his appeal within the statutory time - limit of DATE . This decision was served on the applicant on DATE .

On DATE the applicant requested to be reinstated in the proceedings . He alleged that the court appointed counsel PERSON had promised him during a telephone conversation that he would submit the reasons for the appeal on points of law in due time . As means of evidence , the applicant submitted an affidavit given by his brother .
The applicant further requested the court to withdraw the court - appointed counsel PERSON and to appoint new counsel to submit the reasons for his appeal on points of law .
On DATE ORG informed the applicant that the case - file had been transferred to ORG to rule on his request to appoint fresh counsel .
On DATE the ORG rejected the applicant ’s request to appoint fresh counsel on the ground that the applicant ’s appeal on points of law lacked prospect of success .
On DATE the applicant , represented by counsel PERSON , requested ORG to grant him a fair hearing and to re - open the appeal proceedings .

On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s request to have the proceedings reinstated as being inadmissible . Having regard to the differing submissions made by counsel PERSON , ORG considered that the applicant had failed sufficiently to establish that P. had promised him that he would submit reasons for his appeal .

In any event , the applicant ’s request was inadmissible as the applicant had failed to submit the grounds for his appeal , either through counsel or personally at the court ’s registry , within the time - limit of DATE set down in section CARDINAL of the Code of Criminal Procedure ( see relevant domestic law , below ) .
ORG further rejected the applicant ’s request to re - open the proceedings on the ground that the applicant ’s right to a fair hearing had not been violated .

On DATE the applicant lodged a constitutional complaint in which he complained about the conduct and the length of the proceedings before the criminal courts . On DATE ORG , sitting as a panel of CARDINAL judges , refused to accept his complaint for adjudication .

LAW of LAW in conjunction with the principle of LAW guarantees the right to expeditious proceedings . According to the settled case - law of ORG , the courts and the prosecuting authorities are called upon to draw the consequences of the length of proceedings at any stage of the proceedings . Their possibilities include inter alia the discontinuation of the proceedings pursuant to sections CARDINAL and CARDINALa of the Code of Criminal Procedure , the limitation of the proceedings according to sections CARDINAL and CARDINALa of LAW or a reduction of the sentence ( see , among others , the decision of DATE ( no . CARDINAL , pp . CARDINAL et seq . ; the decision of DATE , nos . CARDINAL BvR CARDINAL/CARDINAL , DATE and DATE ) .
Section CARDINAL [ form and time limit ]

“ CARDINAL . The appeal on points of law shall be filed with the court whose judgment is being contested either orally to be recorded by the registry or in writing within DATE after pronouncement of judgment .
CARDINAL . If pronouncement of judgment did not take place in the defendant ’s presence , the time limit in respect of the defendant shall begin to run upon service of the judgment . ”
Section CARDINAL [ time limit for stating grounds ]

“ CARDINAL . The motions together with the grounds therefor shall be submitted to the court whose judgment is being contested DATE after expiry of the time limit for seeking the appellate remedy . If the judgment has not been served by then , the time limit shall commence upon service thereof .
CARDINAL . The defendant may only do this in the form of a notice signed by defence counsel , or orally to be recorded by the court registry . ”
Section CARDINAL [ request for reinstatement of the proceedings ]
“ CARDINAL . The request for reinstatement of the proceedings shall be filed ... within DATE after cessation of the impediment ( ... ) .

CARDINAL . The facts justifying the request shall be substantiated at the time the request is filed or during the proceedings on the request . The omitted act shall be undertaken within the time limit for filing the request ( ... ) . ”
